title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor, including any supplements, after a public hearing. During control years, the budget must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress. The Mayor must transmit the budget to Congress after completing budget procedures. No unauthorized obligations or expenditures by District of Columbia government officers or employees are allowed, except in specific cases. Restrictions on the reprogramming of amounts are in place after the annual budget for a fiscal year is adopted. No amount can be obligated or expended by any District of Columbia government officer or employee without approval by the Council or Congress. After the annual budget for a fiscal year is adopted, reprogramming of amounts is restricted. The Mayor must request approval from the Council for any reprogramming, with additional expenditures requiring offsetting reductions in another activity. The term 'control year' is defined as per the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The term 'control year' is defined as per the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Congressional review period for budget acts is amended to include new provisions for Acts transmitted under certain conditions. The Congressional review period for budget acts is amended to include new provisions for Acts transmitted under certain conditions, taking effect after a 30-calendar-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within that time. If the 30-day period ends when neither House is in session, the period is extended for 5 additional days. The adjournment period for joint resolutions disapproving Acts is extended for 5 days, excluding certain days. If the resolution passes both Houses and is transmitted to the President within the period, it repeals the Act upon becoming law. The adjournment period for joint resolutions disapproving Acts is extended for 5 days, excluding certain days. If the resolution passes both Houses and is transmitted to the President within the period, it repeals the Act upon becoming law. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. Section 202 of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to include references to section 446 for control years. Amendments are made to sections 202(c)(2) and 202(d)(3)(A) by replacing references to "the first sentence of section 446" with "section 446(a)." The Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 and the National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 are amended to update references to section 446. The table of contents is also amended to reflect these changes. Sec. 446. Enactment of local budget. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of items to the President of the United States. Additionally, there is a conforming amendment to renumber certain sections within the Act. The amendment to Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act changes wording related to transmission of items to the President of the United States and includes a new definition for the term 'control year'. SEC. 4 amends Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. Section 603(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to include federal authority over the budget-making process for control years. Section 603(d) specifies that during control years, the Council and Mayor cannot approve or forward any budget that is inconsistent with the established financial plan and budget. The budget must align with the financial plan established for the fiscal year under the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The term 'control year' is defined in the same Act. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act will apply to the District of Columbia budgets for fiscal years starting on or after October 1, 2004.
